ResponseText: What is patriotism? Patriotism is the last refuge of a scoundrel. -Samuel Johnson.

I don't think you are correct in saying that terms equivalent to anti-americanism have not been used elsewhere. Accuse elderly germans of "anti-germanism", ditto for italians, or start chatting about "anti-sovietism" in an eastern european old peoples home. See what kinds of reactions you get. If you are interested in a scholarly analysis of nationalism and patriotism as cultural phenomenon, and in particular how they developed, Benedict Anderson's Imagined Communities is brilliant.

QuoteText: The problem is when patriots, and sports fans, actually begin to believe their own words and hate other countries/ clubs because of their blind adherence. Fortunately most aren't stupid enough to go down this road.
ResponseText: actually reality suggests that a significant number of people do go down this road. thats exactly what liminus is pointing out. if the country is at war with another country, you would be immediately and unanimously labelled unpatriotic if you had ANY feelings other than hatred for that country. the label also extends to anybody who doesnt fully worship all american leaders, policies, historical figures and inanimate objects that represent abstract aspects of america

Just face it, our Britain is seen throughout the world as a safe place for every crook, illegal immigrant, political asylum seeker, including even terrorists of various sorts. Take, for instance, growing number of extradition requests from only Poland for criminals, who are suspected of such serious crimes in their native country, as murder, rape, robbery, burglary or drugs. In the last 12 months, officers from our Metropolitan Polices Extradition Unit have been asked to track down 257 Poles across the UK (dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/news/worldnews.html?in_article_id=504532&in_page_id=181 1).
